title: GPSA Rulebook
text:
1 GPSA Rulebook
Greater Peninsula Swimming Association December 2025
Welcome to the official rulebook for the Greater Peninsula Swimming Association (GPSA). This rulebook governs all competitive swimming activities within the GPSA, including dual meets, championship meets, and invitational events.

title: GPSA Rulebook
text:
1.1 About This Rulebook
This rulebook establishes the standards and regulations for:

Swimmer Eligibility - Requirements for participation in GPSA-sanctioned meets
Meet Officials - Roles, responsibilities, and certification requirements
Competition Rules - Event structure, conduct, and scoring procedures
Facilities Standards - Pool requirements and technical specifications
Awards - Recognition for individual and team achievements

title: GPSA Rulebook
text:
1.2 Quick Navigation

Definitions - Key terms and their meanings
Eligibility and Rosters - Swimmer qualification requirements
Officials - Roles, responsibilities, and certification
Order of Events - Event sequence, age groups, and distances
Conduct of Meets - Meet procedures and requirements
Scoring - Point system for individual and team events
Awards - Ribbons, trophies, and recognition
Facilities Standards - Pool and equipment requirements

title: GPSA Rulebook
text:
1.3 GPSA Divisions
The GPSA operates three competitive divisions:

Red Division
White Division
Blue Division

Teams compete within their division to determine a division champion each season.

title: GPSA Rulebook
text:
1.4 Questions or Clarifications?
For questions regarding rule interpretations or eligibility, please contact the GPSA Rules Committee through your team’s GPSA Representative.

title: 2  Definitions
text:
2.1 GPSA
This section defines key terms used throughout the GPSA Rulebook.
Greater Peninsula Swimming Association.

title: 2  Definitions
text:
2.2 BONA FIDE SWIMMER
A swimmer who meets all of the following criteria:

The swimmer shall be a member in good standing of the GPSA pool to be represented. For swimmers on a team representing two or more pools, the swimmer need only be a member of one of the represented pools.
Satisfies the age requirements for participation.
Has a GPSA liability waiver signed by a legally appropriate representative of such swimmer.
A swimmer that is a member of a pool that has not sponsored a team for the season may swim for another team for a period of 1 year.

title: 2  Definitions
text:
2.3 CHAMPIONSHIP MEET

Is a swim meet that is open to all qualifying swimmers from any GPSA Team.
Also referred to as CITY MEET.

title: 2  Definitions
text:
2.4 SUMMER SPLASH INVITATIONAL MEET

Is a swim meet that is open to swimmers not qualified for the Championship Meet.
Also referred to as MINI MEET.

title: 2  Definitions
text:
2.5 INTERPOOL MEET
Also known as a dual meet, shall mean a swim meet swum between two pools.

title: 2  Definitions
text:
2.6 TEAM
Is a recognized member of the GPSA that has access to a pool capable of hosting swimming competitions.

title: 2  Definitions
text:
2.7 DIVISION

A grouping of Teams who compete in GPSA-Scheduled swim meets in order to identify a DIVISION champion.
The GPSA operates three divisions, Red, White, and Blue.
